result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denise Charmaine Beard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Denise Charmaine Beard appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Denise Charmaine Beard.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State. Defendant is eligible for an informal DPA. Parties request a status conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Denise Charmaine Beard appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Denise Charmaine Beard.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Denise Charmaine Beard in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Attorney Wait was recently appointed and informs court that he is still awaiting discovery materials and an offer from the State. Defense further requests a scheduling conference date. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HB.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Denise Charmaine Beard in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is re-assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
